Package tictactoe.src

Class Board

java.lang.Object
tictactoe.src.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
contains all of the methods used. for different functions of the game board.
Since:
Java 14
Author:
Aleksi Hyttinen

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()

  • Method Details

    • initializeBoard

      public static char[][] initializeBoard()
      initializes the game board. This method has a welcome message which indicates the boards minimum size, and then asks the user how big they want their board to be.
      Returns:
      an array the size of the users choice.

    • marksToWin

      public static int marksToWin​(char[][] boardArray)
      asks the user how many consecutive marks are needed to win. This method gets the users input and then validates it. The requirements for the input are: If the board is the minimum size (3x3) the marks to win can't be less than three, and if the board is 10x10 or more, you need atleast 5 marks to win.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - is the game board array. Its length is used to determine the validations for the input.
      Returns:
      the amount of marks needed to win.

    • fillBoard

      public static void fillBoard​(char[][] boardArray)
      is used in the initialization, which fills the new board with empty slots marked as '-'.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - is the empty game board array.

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard​(char[][] boardArray)
      prints the game board at it's current state.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - is the game board at it's current state.
